snippet: Rebuffed by Gov. Pete Wilson's decision to deny clemency, lawyers for the man who would be the first person executed by California in 25 years said today that they had new evidence and sought a stay from the courts.    The lawyers for the condemne...
lead_paragraph: Rebuffed by Gov. Pete Wilson's decision to deny clemency, lawyers for the man who would be the first person executed by California in 25 years said today that they had new evidence and sought a stay from the courts. The lawyers for the condemned prisoner, Robert Alton Harris, who is to die in the gas chamber at San Quentin prison on Tuesday, said the new evidence was a statement by Mr. Harris's brother Danny, whose trial testimony helped convict Mr. Harris of the 1978 murder of two San Diego teen-agers.

headline.main: Delay of Execution Asked in California; New Evidence Cited
